intro: Trachoma brevirhachis, commonly known as the short-stalked trachoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies for various ailments.
